name: unserialize
purpose: Creates a PHP value from a stored representation

return.description:
The converted value is returned, and can be a boolean,
   integer, float, string,
   array or object.In case the passed string is not unserializeable, FALSE is returned and
   E_NOTICE is issued.

notes.description:
FALSE is returned both in the case of an error and if unserializing
    the serialized FALSE value. It is possible to catch this special case by
    comparing str with
    serialize(false) or by catching the issued
    E_NOTICE.
